title: To Whoever Took the Time to Fix Aatrox's Walk Animation on the PBE
body:
After a year and a half since the rework launched, it's really nice to be able walk around without the noticeable jank that made Aatrox feel that much incomplete.

So to whoever finally took the time to give it a lookover, I say thanks a bunch.

replies.body: Seconding OP's sentiments. Thank you for fixing my boy's walk! Now he can chad stride as smooth as butter!
Now if only they could fix akali's walk.

> [{quoted}](name=Kanzler,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=dyjABMrK,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2019-08-22T13:58:05.696+0000)
>
> Now if only they could fix akali's walk.

Akali's tippy-toeing is the cutest walk cycle in league, stay away from waifu. Grrrrrr

Akali's walk cycle is fine, it's just unusual(the WAY she walks is what's weird, not the way it's animated). In that case, I feel like it's better to leave it, since subtle animations give a degree of depth to the character. Is it an old habit? Is it intentional, perhaps to throw people off? Is it just supposed to be amusing, and not a canon thing?


A REALLY good example is Zoe's walk cycle. It's not practical, and it's not really supposed to be.
They kinda tried to use ninja walk (to avoid stumbling in the dark) but gave it short steps instead of big ones.
Could you give a clip of what you are talking about?
